questions.text: Which of these school subjects do you find most engaging?

options.A: Physics or Chemistry, due to their logical rules and experiments (Science)
options.B: History, Literature, or Fine Arts, for their creative and social insights (Arts & Humanities)
options.C: Business Studies or Economics, for understanding financial systems (Commerce)
options.D: Computer Science, because you enjoy coding and building applications (Computers)
options.E: Workshop classes or vocational training for practical, hands-on skills (Vocational)

questions.text: When facing a complex problem, what is your first instinct?

options.A: Break it down and analyze it systematically (Science)
options.B: Consider its human impact and brainstorm creative or ethical solutions (Arts & Humanities)
options.C: Assess the risks and potential return on investment (Commerce)
options.D: Write a script or algorithm to automate a solution (Computers)
options.E: Start building or tinkering with a practical prototype (Vocational)

questions.text: What role do you naturally play in a group project?

options.A: The researcher who gathers and verifies data (Science)
options.B: The communicator and designer who shapes the narrative and visuals (Arts & Humanities)
options.C: The manager who sets deadlines and manages the budget (Commerce)
options.D: The tech expert who handles the digital tools and software (Computers)
options.E: The implementer who does the hands-on work to bring the idea to life (Vocational)

questions.text: What kind of work environment makes you feel most energized?

options.A: A laboratory or a research-focused institution (Science)
options.B: A library, university, creative studio, or government office (Arts & Humanities)
options.C: A fast-paced corporate office or a start-up (Commerce)
options.D: A tech company with a focus on innovation and coding (Computers)
options.E: A workshop, a kitchen, or an outdoor field (Vocational)

questions.text: What would you prefer to create?

options.A: A new scientific theory or a working experiment (Science)
options.B: A well-argued essay, a social policy, or a piece of art (Arts & Humanities)
options.C: A successful business plan or a profitable investment portfolio (Commerce)
options.D: A useful software application or a complex website (Computers)
options.E: A piece of furniture, a delicious meal, or a well-maintained garden (Vocational)

questions.text: How do you prefer to learn new things?

options.A: Through structured experiments and data analysis (Science)
options.B: Through reading, debating, storytelling, and visual expression (Arts & Humanities)
options.C: Through case studies, financial models, and market analysis (Commerce)
options.D: Through coding tutorials, documentation, and building projects (Computers)
options.E: Through hands-on practice, apprenticeship, and direct experience (Vocational)

questions.text: A global crisis occurs. What aspect of it interests you most?

options.A: The scientific data behind it and potential technological solutions (Science)
options.B: The historical precedents and its impact on society and culture (Arts & Humanities)
options.C: The effect on the global economy, supply chains, and markets (Commerce)
options.D: The role of technology in communication and data tracking during the crisis (Computers)
options.E: The immediate, practical needs of the community and how to help (Vocational)

questions.text: Which of these activities sounds like a perfect weekend?

options.A: Visiting a science museum or watching a documentary on space (Science)
options.B: Visiting a historical site, art gallery, or attending a public debate (Arts & Humanities)
options.C: Following the stock market or brainstorming a new business idea (Commerce)
options.D: Participating in a hackathon or learning a new programming language (Computers)
options.E: Working on a DIY project at home, cooking, or gardening (Vocational)

questions.text: What tool are you most comfortable using?

options.A: A microscope or a telescope (Science)
options.B: A library card, a well-reasoned argument, or a paintbrush (Arts & Humanities)
options.C: A spreadsheet or a business plan template (Commerce)
options.D: A code editor or a command line interface (Computers)
options.E: A hammer, a wrench, or a sewing machine (Vocational)

questions.text: What kind of impact do you want to have on the world?

options.A: To advance human knowledge and make new discoveries (Science)
options.B: To create a more just, equitable, and culturally rich society (Arts & Humanities)
options.C: To create wealth, jobs, and economic opportunities (Commerce)
options.D: To build technology that solves real-world problems and connects people (Computers)
options.E: To provide essential services and build tangible things for the community (Vocational)

questions.text: Which section of a bookstore do you naturally gravitate towards?

options.A: Science and Nature (Science)
options.B: History, Politics, Fiction, or Art & Photography (Arts & Humanities)
options.C: Business and Economics (Commerce)
options.D: Computers and Technology (Computers)
options.E: DIY, Crafts, or Home & Garden (Vocational)

questions.text: How do you define 'success'?

options.A: Publishing a groundbreaking research paper (Science)
options.B: Winning a major legal case, influencing public policy, or creating acclaimed art (Arts & Humanities)
options.C: Building a profitable company from the ground up (Commerce)
options.D: Developing a widely used piece of software (Computers)
options.E: Being recognized as a master of your craft or trade (Vocational)

questions.text: What's your favorite type of game to play?

options.A: Complex strategy games that require analytical thinking (Science)
options.B: Role-playing games with rich stories, or debate and trivia clubs (Arts & Humanities)
options.C: Monopoly or other economic simulation games (Commerce)
options.D: Video games, especially programming or puzzle-based ones (Computers)
options.E: Sports or games that require physical skill and coordination (Vocational)

questions.text: If you were to start a YouTube channel, what would it be about?

options.A: Explaining complex scientific concepts simply (Science)
options.B: Analyzing political events, historical trends, or showcasing creative work (Arts & Humanities)
options.C: Giving financial advice and reviewing businesses (Commerce)
options.D: Live-coding sessions or tech gadget reviews (Computers)
options.E: Tutorials on how to build, cook, or repair things (Vocational)

questions.text: When you read the news, which headlines catch your eye?

options.A: New breakthroughs in medicine or space exploration (Science)
options.B: Updates on international relations, social justice, or film reviews (Arts & Humanities)
options.C: The latest stock market trends and company mergers (Commerce)
options.D: Launches of new apps or advancements in artificial intelligence (Computers)
options.E: News about new construction projects or agricultural innovations (Vocational)

questions.text: What does 'innovation' mean to you?

options.A: Conducting novel research to push the boundaries of knowledge (Science)
options.B: Developing new social theories or creating a new style of art (Arts & Humanities)
options.C: Creating a disruptive business model that changes an industry (Commerce)
options.D: Writing a new algorithm that solves a problem more efficiently (Computers)
options.E: Inventing a new tool or technique that makes a task easier (Vocational)

questions.text: How do you prefer to organize information?

options.A: In logical charts, graphs, and data tables (Science)
options.B: As a timeline, a structured essay, or a visual mind map (Arts & Humanities)
options.C: In a budget, a business plan, or a balance sheet (Commerce)
options.D: In a database, a structured data format like JSON, or a codebase (Computers)
options.E: As a set of clear, step-by-step instructions or a checklist (Vocational)

questions.text: What do you find most satisfying?

options.A: Finally understanding a complex scientific theory (Science)
options.B: Winning a debate or completing a piece of art that expresses your vision (Arts & Humanities)
options.C: Closing a profitable deal or making a smart investment (Commerce)
options.D: Fixing a difficult bug in a piece of code (Computers)
options.E: Successfully repairing a broken object with your hands (Vocational)

questions.text: Which of these professionals do you admire the most?

options.A: A Nobel Prize-winning scientist like Marie Curie (Science)
options.B: A transformative leader or a visionary artist (Arts & Humanities)
options.C: A revolutionary entrepreneur like Steve Jobs (Commerce)
options.D: A pioneering programmer like Ada Lovelace (Computers)
options.E: A master craftsperson known for their exceptional skill (Vocational)

questions.text: If you had to teach a class, what subject would you choose?

options.A: Physics 101 (Science)
options.B: Modern World History or Creative Writing (Arts & Humanities)
options.C: Principles of Marketing (Commerce)
options.D: Introduction to Python Programming (Computers)
options.E: Basic Carpentry or Cooking (Vocational)

questions.text: What are you most curious about?

options.A: How the universe works at a quantum level (Science)
options.B: Why civilizations rise and fall, or how art affects emotion (Arts & Humanities)
options.C: What makes some businesses succeed while others fail (Commerce)
options.D: How to build an artificial intelligence that can learn (Computers)
options.E: How to build a self-sustaining home (Vocational)

questions.text: What kind of documentary would you choose to watch?

options.A: One about the natural world or a scientific discovery (Science)
options.B: One about a major historical event or the life of a famous artist (Arts & Humanities)
options.C: One about the rise and fall of a major corporation (Commerce)
options.D: One about the history of the internet or hacking culture (Computers)
options.E: One that follows a master craftsperson at work (Vocational)

questions.text: When you think about the future, what are you most excited about?

options.A: Future scientific breakthroughs and technological advancements (Science)
options.B: The potential for positive social change and new forms of art (Arts & Humanities)
options.C: New markets and opportunities for global business (Commerce)
options.D: The evolution of AI and its integration into daily life (Computers)
options.E: The development of new sustainable technologies and crafts (Vocational)

questions.text: What do you value most in a team member?

options.A: Their analytical ability and attention to detail (Science)
options.B: Their empathy, communication skills, and creativity (Arts & Humanities)
options.C: Their ambition and ability to execute a plan (Commerce)
options.D: Their technical proficiency and problem-solving skills (Computers)
options.E: Their reliability and practical, can-do attitude (Vocational)

questions.text: How do you view rules?

options.A: As natural laws to be discovered and understood (Science)
options.B: As social constructs or creative conventions to be analyzed and challenged (Arts & Humanities)
options.C: As regulations and frameworks necessary for a functioning market (Commerce)
options.D: As algorithms and protocols that ensure a system works correctly (Computers)
options.E: As safety guidelines and best practices for a good result (Vocational)

questions.text: If you received a large grant, how would you use it?

options.A: To fund a scientific research project (Science)
options.B: To establish a non-profit for social change or produce an independent film (Arts & Humanities)
options.C: To invest in a promising new business venture (Commerce)
options.D: To start a tech company to build a new app (Computers)
options.E: To open a community workshop or a training center (Vocational)

questions.text: When you look at a skyscraper, what do you think about?

options.A: The physics and engineering principles that keep it standing (Science)
options.B: The social impact it has on the neighborhood and its aesthetic design (Arts & Humanities)
options.C: The financial investment and real estate value of the property (Commerce)
options.D: The smart technology and network infrastructure within the building (Computers)
options.E: The immense amount of labor and materials required to build it (Vocational)

questions.text: Which task would you find least boring?

options.A: Spending hours meticulously analyzing a dataset (Science)
options.B: Spending hours in an archive or practicing a creative skill (Arts & Humanities)
options.C: Spending hours analyzing financial reports and market data (Commerce)
options.D: Spending hours debugging a large and complex codebase (Computers)
options.E: Spending hours carefully assembling a complicated piece of machinery (Vocational)

questions.text: What kind of puzzle do you enjoy most?

options.A: Logic puzzles or mathematical brain teasers (Science)
options.B: Crossword puzzles, word games, or murder mysteries (Arts & Humanities)
options.C: Strategy games focused on resource management (Commerce)
options.D: Algorithmic challenges or code-breaking puzzles (Computers)
options.E: Mechanical puzzles like a Rubik's Cube or a 3D jigsaw (Vocational)

questions.text: Your ideal vacation involves...

options.A: A trip to a natural wonder to observe its unique ecosystem (Science)
options.B: Exploring ancient ruins or the world's great art museums (Arts & Humanities)
options.C: Visiting a global financial hub like New York or Tokyo (Commerce)
options.D: Attending a major tech conference or a coding bootcamp (Computers)
options.E: A hands-on workshop to learn a new skill like pottery or cooking (Vocational)
